direction.raw_text: Thank you for this, Vince -- VINCE (a pained look on his face)

direction.raw_text: I said put your feet by my feet not on my feet! -- Julius looks at his brother, then self-consciously takes his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll lead, you follow. Okay, one, two, three, turn... (AD LIB as follows) ... put your arm here -- you're breaking my fingers -- you're not wrestling a boar 300 miles south southwest of Fiji -- don't clench your teeth -- Vince begins to take Julius through the steps slowly at first, then as Julius gains confidence they begin to sail round the room, and we -- CUT TO: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88                                    102.          * 136    INT. DADDY'S GIRL - NIGHT                                     136 Julius and Marnie in the middle of the large dance floor in a large club -- and Julius is waltzing magnificently. Marnie, thrilled, stays with him step for step as we -- PULL BACK to reveal -- Vince and Linda, waltzing brilliantly, too. The four of them have the whole floor to themselves as other dancers ring the area, watching and shouting encouragement. The SONG ENDS -- Everyone applauds -- Our two couples head over to their table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you've learned to waltz. Now it's time to introduce you to the wonderful world of getting shit-faced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A137   INT. DADDY'S GIRL - BOOTH                                     A137 Vince, Linda, Julius and Marnie are seated at a table covered with quite a few empty beer bottles. They are all a little drunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you know they had beer in ancient Egypt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Er... no...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually it was invented by the Assyrians, but the Eygptians were the first people to perfect the malt fermentation process.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure know a lot about beer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He knows a lot about everything. Julius polishes off the bottle, belches. (CONTINUED) )J(    TWINS - Rev. 6/16/88                                      103.          * A137   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it's all from books. Until tonight I never had a beer. All theory, no practice -- the story of my life!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julius, embarrassed, looks over at Marnie, who's smiling sweetly at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Linda, surprised, does a spit-take with her beer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vince gets to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vince exits.    Julius looks at Marnie, blushes, gets to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julius takes off after Vince.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : B137   INT. DADDY'S GIRL - MEN'S ROOM - NIGHT                        B137 As Vince and Julius approach the urinals. The both si- multaneously flush before unzipping. Julius smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: * B137   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (lying) Not all the time. (a beat) Listen, Marnie's got the hots for you. Tonight could be your lucky night...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They both finish at the urinals and begin washing at the sink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julius, a little smashed, can't hide his feelings.    He grips Vince by the shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julius starts to do so, just as another man enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julius releases Vince, who clocks the other man's reaction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lookin' forward to it. As Beetroot hangs up, the CAMERA SLOWLY PANS to reveal he is not alone. In the b.g. is a very hard-looking man, Beetroot's bodyguard. And standing close to the desk is WEBSTER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, Webster, looks like I'm doin' business with someone else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd do the same thing. You want the delivery, it's not your problem who delivers. (handing him a card) If you ever need me, my answering service forwards all messages. And he's gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put this in my personal file. (staring at the door) God, I love a professional... 139   OMITTED                                                 139   * &                                                             & 140
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Rev. 5/2/88                                     105. 141   INT. DADDY'S GIRL - BOOTH - NIGHT                              141 Linda and Marnie, both a little tipsy. Linda suddenly freezes at the sight of Morris Klane scoping the room. Morris is still wearing a bandage from his beating by Julius.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you tell anybody we were coming to Santa Fe?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I phoned work and told them we wouldn't be coming in for a few days... Oh, I forgot to tell you -- we've been fired.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go to the ladies' room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But we just went. Linda takes Marnie by the hand, just as -- BURT AND BOB KLANE each with a cast on his foot, each supported by a crutch, force them back into the booth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, girls -- Do you mind if we sit down and enjoy the music with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : VINCE AND JULIUS approach the table. Burt and Bob open their jackets, revealing they have guns on the girls. Morris Klane appears behind Vince and Julius.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This has gone way past a simple case of loan deliquency.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't like getting shot.                                *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about?    We didn't shoot anybody. (CONTINUED) TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88                                      106. 141   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's no way to do business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We want to take Vince out to the parking lot and kill him. A long beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's kind of drastic, don't you think? Morris grabs Vince roughly by the arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't touch him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is not your problem -- you                          * don't want me to hurt these lovely ladies, do you? He pushes his gun into Marnie's side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You moved too soon...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The second rule in a crisis situation:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's starting that funny talk again... (CONTINUED) TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88                                 107.          * 141    CONTINUED:    (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Burt gives a small head signal and two very large men stand up from a nearby table. They each grab one of Julius's arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just then, so sudden and quick that it's over as soon as it begins, Julius double kicks the seated Burt and Bob in the head. They're out cold before they realize they've been attacked. Without stopping, Julius whips his arms together in front of him bringing Sam and Dave into painful contact with each others' head. They, too, are now out cold. Vince uses this opportunity to stomp, with all his might, on the toe of Morris who's busy watching Julius dismantle his relatives. Morris screams and lets go of Vince, who runs to the nearby pool table, grabs a cue and slams it over the head of the now hobbling Morris. All five Klanes are out cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SANTA FE MOTEL - ESTABLISHING - NIGHT              B143 )O(   TWINS - Rev. 7/5/88                                      108.         * 143   INT. MOTEL ROOM - NIGHT                                         143 Julius is unpacking his suitcase on one of the beds -- arranging his books on the bedside table, hanging his clothes on hangars. Vince watches him, glances at his watch, and begins to edge towards the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh... we got cable TV, a fully stocked bar, free ice -- we're in great shape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where you going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought I'd just go and tuck Linda in for the night. Vince picks up one of Julius' heavy tomes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe read her a bedtime story. (with a wink) Don't wait up for me. Julius looks fondly at his brother as he sees him to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a day, Vincent, we visited our birth place. We bought new clothes. We danced the waltz. We get into a fight -- We've got this great room. (heart-felt) It just doesn't get any better than this. Vince gives Julius a sly look as he lets himself out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yes it does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : CLOSE - A TV SCREEN showing a clip of the "3 Stooges" at their moronic best. JULIUS sits watching the TV, nodding in amusement, laughing, slapping his knee in pleasure. (CONTINUED) )O(   TWINS - Rev. 7/5/88                                    108A.      * 143   CONTINUED:    (A1)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He returns his attention to the book he's been reading -- something the size of a dictionary -- but can't help returning his gaze to the TV. He freezes at the sound of a KNOCK at the DOOR. Embar- rassed by what he's been watching, he quickly turns off the TV, and goes to answer the door, still holding the book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You forgot your key -- I know. Lucky I waited up. Julius opens the door, revealing Marnie, who walks in right past him. (CONTINUED) TWINS - Rev. 4/28/88                                    109. 143   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.                                                     *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi -- Vince and Linda want to be                        * alone, so I'm afraid I'm going to stay here. Which bed should I take?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Either... I always sleep on the floor. Watched by Julius, Marnie pulls the curtains shut, kills the overhead lights, all the while providing him with glimpses of various parts of her anatomy. She gets into one of the beds, turns off the bedside lamp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good night. Julius puts the blanket and pillow from the other bed onto the floor between the two beds, then shuts off the other lamp. Silence...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This mattress is awful. Getting out of bed, she pulls the blanket and pillow with her as she steps over Julius, who tries not to look up, and gets into the other bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry.   Good night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good night. Silence...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This mattress is just as bad as the other one. She gets out, again dragging the blanket and pillow, puts them down on the floor next to Julius. She crawls under the blanket, turns her back to him. (CONTINUED) )O(   TWINS - Rev. 7/5/88                                  110. 143   CONTINUED:     (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is better... Good night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good night. Silence.     Marnie shivers, chattering her teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you cold?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's alright.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, please, take my shirt.      I'm               * baking. Julius strips it off and hands it to her. She puts it on and pulls the blanket over her shoulder. Again she shivers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You still cold?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just my legs. Julius lies there, thinking about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I could give you my...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. Julius reaches under the blanket, removes his bottoms and passes them over. Marnie puts them on under her blanket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd love a glass of water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. He wraps his blanket around his waist, goes into the bathroom, comes out with a glass of water. He hands it to her. (CONTINUED) TWINS - Rev. 4/28/88                                    111. 143   CONTINUED:    (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. She spills the water all over her top and bedding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, great! She starts stripping off everything she's wearing.      Julius averts his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you mind if I share your blanket? -- Mine's all wet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No -- that would be okay. They both lie down under his blanket.      Silence...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could we switch sides?   I like to sleep on the left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. She starts to roll over Julius, then pauses directly above him and looks him dead in the eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I ask you something for a change?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you like me? I mean, even a little bit?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I'm crazy about you, Marnie. But there's something about me you ought to know. Marnie tenses, expecting the worst.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a virgin. (CONTINUED) TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88                                    112. 143   CONTINUED:    (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marnie glances heavenward, and silently mouths the words "thank you." She smiles down at Julius and starts very gently kissing him.
direction.name: direction

VINCE AND LINDA'S HOTEL ROOM - NIGHT                  146 Linda, dressed in a negligee, comes out of the bathroom area. Vince, wearing pajamas, is on the floor, legs curled under the bed, doing sit-ups.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eighteen -- nineteen -- LINDA You sick or something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julius gave me a few pointers -- (counting)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seventy-five -- seventy-six -- I don't need to exercise, but Mom's gonna see me for the first                       * time in thirty-five years, I wanna look my best.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She'll love you whatever you look like.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know she will -- I have that effect on people -- (counting)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One hundred and forty-three --                      * one forty-four --                                      * (beat)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just hope she's not too disappointed in Julius -- he can't help how weird he seems at the start -- (CONTINUED) )T(   TWINS - Rev. 7/5/88 PM                                 113.         * 146   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you're nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey -- I sleep great every night -- (beat; softer)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: what if she's disappointed in me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Five hundred. (gets up) Don't want to overdo. He goes into her arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If she's disappointed in you, then she's a fake -- who could want more from a son?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right. (a beat) I couldn't do this without you, Linda.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. That's why, when we get back, I think we should move in together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoa!   Move in together?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not saying we have to    get married or anything, and    it's not about me wanting to keep    an eye on you, either. (warmly) I just want to live with    you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm no good at playing house -- I'm grouchy in the morning, cranky in the afternoon, moody at night -- (CONTINUED) )T(   TWINS - Rev. 7/5/88 PM                                   113A.     * 146   CONTINUED:    (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I promise not to try and make you happy unless you want me to. Vince is clearly unnerved by the twin emotional demands of Linda and meeting his mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't we sleep on this, okay? I mean, I've got a big day tomorrow. (shifting gears) It's gonna be great -- taking my best girl to meet my mom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Am I really your best girl?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's nobody else, Linda, not anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There better not be, because... (quoting)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: only have eyes for you...' They kiss.

JULIUS AND MARNIE'S MOTEL ROOM - NIGHT (LATER)       147 They're both gazing up at the ceiling, bathed in after- glow. Marnie has obviously just had the sexual experience of her life. Julius is equally dazed and happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure you've never done this before?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I would have remembered... They start to kiss and we start to hear four RAUCOUS VOICES singing a great old ROCK SONG a capella.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's our heroes singing. The Cadillac is moving quickly through the extraordinary landscape.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julius smiles happily at Vince's thoughtfulness. 148    EXT. WHISPERING PINES - DAY                                     148 In the mountains, which dramatically tower over a lovely, wide park-like area with a large adobe building and a few smaller satellite huts. The car drives up a long, dusty driveway to the entrance, which is protected by high gates. Our principals exit the car. They approach the fortress-like gated entrance, gazing around at the magnificent scenery. Both men carry flowers and seem self-conscious about the prospect of finally meeting their mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julius smiles at Vince and rings the bell. A MALE CUSTODIAN answers the door -- friendly but very firm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: TWINS - Rev. 5/2/88                                      118. 148    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'd like to see Miss Mary Anne Benedict, please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he starts to close the door, Vince takes charge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Custodian politely closes the door in their faces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A149   EXT. WHISPERING PINES - OUTER GARDEN WALL - DAY              A149 Our principals circle the wall, try a locked door to no avail. They'll have to go over. Julius boosts Marnie over the wall. Linda boosts Vince over. CUT TO: B149   OMITTED                                                         B149 C149   EXT. WHISPERING PINES - INNER GARDEN - DAY                   C149 Our principals take in the scene -- a large, enclosed garden, with pathways, shady trees, all very lovely, with a great view of the sun setting against the surrounding mountains. Their attention is drawn to -- A PAINTER working at an easel. Several young artists are gathered around her, admiringly. This is happening underneath a beautiful old tree and the sight is just lovely. CUT TO: (CONTINUED) TWINS - Rev. 5/2/88                                    119. C149   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They stand still watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gotta be. (as they still stare) Well, don't just stand there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Introduce yourselves.                                   * As they take a step in the direction of the painter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : FEMALE GARDNER on her knees. She's in work clothes, smudged, hair in a bandana. Maybe 60, there's something terribly appealing about her. She's her own woman. She gets up from her knees now as they approach -- but not before we note the quality of her gardening -- it's the size Julius had back on the island.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: TWINS - Rev. 4/28/88                                     120.        * C149   CONTINUED:    (2)

direction.name: direction

ROADSIDE DINER (NEW MEXICO) - LATE AFTERNOON             153 Julius, Vince, Linda and Marnie are quietly sitting at a roadside table, eating some junk food. (CONTINUED) TWINS - Rev. 6/22/88                                   123. 153   CONTINUED:                                                    153 LINDA You ought to be so proud of your mother, Vince. She donated her house and her land and all her paintings to help young artists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I look like a young artist to you, Linda?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vince, all she meant was -- VINCE (picking a fight) I know what she meant. And I know why she's here, too. It's got nothing to do with my mother and everything to do with money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know that's not true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bull-shit. Julius, who's been quiet and distant throughout, suddenly intercedes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take it easy, Vincent.   It's not her fault.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hear that, everybody? The                          * creature from the black lagoon                         * just put in his two bits. I                            * should have my head examined for listening to you in the first place
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: deal-of-a-lifetime opportunity and I'm driving around looking for a dead mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All I wanted was to make us into a family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Family, my butt. There's no family here. There's just me and three losers -- I'm leaving. (CONTINUED) TWINS - Rev. 6/22/88                                     124.      * 153   CONTINUED:    (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vince storms off, gets into the Caddy and squeals away, throwing Julius's suitcase out the window as he goes. Linda and Marnie take off after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vince -- quit acting crazy -- MARNIE (stunned) He dumped us in the middle of New Mexico.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll be fine. And maybe he'll be better off alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know -- he's got something worth maybe millions in that trunk -- he could get himself killed delivering it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's been getting out of trouble all his life, he's good at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He may need you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know much anymore -- on the island I was smart. Here, I've only made things worse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you realize you could make things a lot worse if you don't do something. (gently; close beside him now) Julius -- you're still very smart it's just you're not thinking so well right now -- on account of what you found out at Whispering Pines -- but you're not alone, you know -- I mean, you live long enough, everyone's mother dies... No reaction from Julius.    It's impossible to tell what he's thinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88                                  124A. 154   INT. CADDY - VINCE - DUSK                                 154 in the Cadillac.   He's driving very fast and is on the car phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, Beetroot -- It's time. I'll be there tomorrow -- where do we meet and trade?
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : JULIUS trying to fight his excitement, watching as the prisoner moves toward him -- -- then past him. Julius, confused, stares for a moment straight ahead across the partition, and now he's more confused -- -- because Vince is sitting across from him, dubiously studying him, arms crossed. There are phones on both sides of the glass partition. The room, it should be noted, is busy. Julius makes a smile. Vince just stares. Julius mutters "excuse me" and gets up, goes to a nearby GUARD. (CONTINUED) TWINS - 4/14/88                                         32. 54   CONTINUED:
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (impassioned, but a bit rambling; his emotions are in control)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a beat; then, quietly) Due this morning. *
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know where my head is -- I forgot I promised this friend of mine -- Sammy -- I'd pick up his car at the airport -- do me a big favor, okay? Drive this car back from the airport for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing with that finger?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (as she reaches for some cake mix)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : WEBSTER He looks at the Cadillac key.    Clearly, he is not happy at the turn of events.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : 73   INT. VINCE'S DINING ROOM - LATER                             73 They've finished eating.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: New Caddy? Let's check it out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (deciding and getting in the car) Sorry -- the car's been promised for a kid's charity.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calling out) Okay -- Six thousand -- that's as high as I'm going...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (getting up, heading for the door, shaking his head)

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: climbing over the wall like that, I should call the police -- VINCE Please don't do that -- look -- this isn't one of your average everyday situations -- she's our mother is the thing.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (takes off her gardening gloves) I'll bet you are -- follow me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (whispering to Julius) We were right -- JULIUS (softly)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (confused) We thought that that woman -- VINCE -- Is Mary Ann?

dialogue.raw_text: No -- This is an artist's colony; there's a lot of painters. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is some chunk of real estate
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mom owns it all, I guess.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can't really own something like that view over there, or that sunset, can you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Linda and Marnie) I can't wait to meet her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mary Anne Benedict never understood why people wanted to buy her paintings. But for a brief period they were considered valuable. She used the money to buy Whispering Pines so that young artists would have a place to work. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She never wanted to be famous. She just wanted to be left alone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: May I ask you a question? (a beat, concerned) Why do you keep referring to her in the past tense?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because she passed away, some time ago.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But -- but you said she was here -- GARDENER She is -- I meant her spirit.   Her spirit is always here. (a beat) Excuse me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (behind the wheel) Can we get the hell out of here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: These real estate developers won't be happy until they turn this place into a golf course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now they're climbing over the walls?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're shameless. They'll try anything. (bitterly amused) Those men claimed to be my twin sons, if you can believe that. It was really quite disturbing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Mary Anne, I am sorry...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's alright... You get over things.                       * (with a sigh) I did have a child once, but he died                       * at birth...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I had to break into your apartment, but -- LINDA Vince, they're beautiful.

direction.raw_text: I just can't get over how alike they are... The three women all turn and gaze affectionately back at -- VINCE AND JULIUS Walking along the path behind them. We assume it's them the women were discussing, until we notice that each of them is pushing a double-stroller with identical twin babies inside! It's the twin children that are the source of the women's wonder, and Vince and Julius' as well. Vince and Julius both yawn simultaneously.

direction.raw_text: I think you need your diaper changed. (to baby #2) What a surprise -- so do you. Vince becomes aware of the condition of his kids' diapers.
